title: Prince Andrew hosts 60th birthday bash for Sarah Ferguson
text:
Prince Andrew thanked Sarah Ferguson for supporting him 'in his hour of need' on Tuesday, as he hosted a lavish party for his ex-wife's 60th birthday, according to one guest.

The Queen's second son, Andrew, 59, threw the star-studded bash at his home in Windsor, and invited celebrities such as Ellie Goulding, Robbie Williams and Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellows.

Libyan gun smuggler Tarek Kaituni was among the 100-strong guest list, former royal editor and biographer Phil Dampier told The Sun.

It comes as Andrew faces ongoing scrutiny over his friendship with the disgraced billionaire Jeffrey Epstein, who took his own life in prison last month.

The Duke has vehemently denied claims by Epstein's alleged 'sex slave' Virginia Roberts that she had sex with the Prince on three occasions, the first when she was 17.

Prince Andrew thanked Sarah Ferguson (pictured yesterday at the Lady Garden Foundation Gala 2019) for supporting him 'in his hour of need' on Tuesday, as he hosted a lavish party for his ex-wife's 60th birthday, according to one guest

Sarah with Prince Andrew at Royal Ascot in June this year. The Queen's second son, Andrew, 59, threw the star-studded bash at his home in Windsor

'Andrew was telling people how much Sarah had been there for him in his hour of need,' one guest told the publication.

'It’s a mystery to many of their friends why they don’t remarry. They seem so made for each other and must be the happiest divorced couple in the world!'

The duo live together at the Royal Lodge, a 30-room home in Berkshire, despite divorcing in 1996, ten years after they were first married.

The Duke and Duchess of York split six years after their wedding in Westminster Abbey, but have stayed 'best friends' for their two daughters Princess Eugenie and Princess Beatrice.

Eugenie and her husband Jack, together with Beatrice and her fiancé Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi were said to be first on the dance floor at their mother's party.

Meanwhile, Kaituni’s presence at Tuesday's event will raise further questions about the Duke’s judgement. Kaituni once boasted of his influence over the Duke of York and was a guest at Eugenie's wedding.

The 100-strong guest list included singer Ellie Goulding (pictured left with Fergie in 2017) and Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellows (pictured right with Sarah in 2017)

The guest list reportedly saw the well-known stars drinking Laurent Perrier pink champagne alongside convicted Libyan gun smuggler Tarek Kaituni (pictured)

The company Andrew keeps has often been a source of controversy for the Royals, with the duke coming under fire in recent months for his friendship with Epstein.

Virginia Giuffre, who alleges she was a victim of Epstein, has said she was forced into sexual encounters with the Duke.

Buckingham Palace and the Duke have strongly denied the accusations.

Prince Andrew visited Epstein on Epstein's atoll in the US Virgin Islands - which was dubbed Paedophile Island because of the stream of young women arriving.

Prince Andrew seemingly with his arm around the waist of Virginia Roberts Giuffre, then aged 17 in 2001

He also visited the financier's £60million Manhattan house in December 2010, shortly after Epstein had been released from an 18-month sentence for child prostitution offences.

The royal has denied all allegations of wrongdoing and a statement from Buckingham Palace on behalf of Andrew said the allegations were 'false and without foundation'.

Epstein was arrested by federal authorities in July and held at a Manhattan lockup, where he died by suicide before he could be tried for running a child prostitution ring.
